summary: Application for crafting-focused video games: users can search/select a game and browse all craftable/buildable items (food, tools, buildings) with required supplies, upgrades, and values, kept up-to-date via internet-sourced updates.
architectural_notes: Needs an external data ingestion/update mechanism (e.g., APIs, scraping, or community datasets) to keep crafting data current; define update frequency and data source strategy.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- App logo, workshop-ledger style, simple emblem (app-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Wide banner illustration, cozy crafting bench with parchment/ledger aesthetic (hero-banner.dim_1600x900.png)

existing_features.title: Add a data update mechanism that can incorporate crafting database updates “from the internet”: allow each game to have one or more configurable remote data sources (HTTPS URL endpoints returning JSON). Implement backend functions to (a) fetch and validate remote data, (b) upsert it into stored game/item data, and (c) record per-game lastUpdated timestamp and update status (success/failure + message). Provide a manual “Refresh data” action callable from the frontend to trigger an update for a selected game.

Build the frontend UX to look up and select a game, then browse that game’s crafting database: a game search/list page; a game detail page with category tabs/filters (Food/Tools/Buildings/Other); an item list with search; and an item detail view showing required supplies, possible upgrades, and values in a clear, scannable layout.

Use React Query for all backend data fetching and cache invalidation. Ensure refresh/update operations invalidate the relevant queries (game metadata, item lists, item details) so the UI stays consistent.

Establish a coherent visual theme for the app and apply it consistently across pages (typography, spacing, components, and colors). Theme direction: ‘Workshop ledger’—warm neutrals, paper-like surfaces, subtle grid/ruled accents, and crafting-inspired iconography. Avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors.
Add generated static image assets to support the theme and reference them in the UI (store in frontend/public/assets/generated). Include: an app logo and a subtle hero/banner illustration.

new_feature_requests.summary: Game lookup/search to select a crafting-based video game and view its crafting database
For a selected game, list all buildable/craftable objects (e.g., food, tools, buildings)
Show per-item details: required supplies/materials, possible upgrades, and item values
Automatically track and incorporate crafting data updates from the internet (keep game data current)

Create a core data model for crafting-focused video games that supports: (1) games, (2) craftable/buildable objects (food, tools, buildings, etc.), (3) per-object required supplies/materials with quantities, (4) per-object possible upgrades (upgrade paths/levels and their added/changed requirements), and (5) per-object values (e.g., sell value, durability, stats, or other numeric/string value fields). Persist this data in the Motoko backend so it can be queried by the frontend.

Implement backend query APIs to support the app’s primary flows: list/search games; fetch a game by id; list/search/filter craftable items for a selected game (by name and category); fetch craftable item details by id including supplies, upgrades, and values.

projectName: Crafting Database App for Video Games (Game Search, Item Browser, Recipes, Upgrades, Web Updates)
